The house had plenty of room for our 3 boys (14 yo, 12 yo, 9 yo), my wife and I. The kids rooms were on one side of the house and the master was on the other side, so we were able to sleep-in. The kitchen had everything needed to prepare meals. There is a coffee pot/K-cup combo machine with coffee and filters provided. Consider bringing more if you are a big coffee drinker. Great internet with smart TV in the living room made for great movie nights.
Our favorite part of this house was the outdoor patio overlooking the lake and the massive fire pit. David provides plenty of firewood and enough s'mores for one night, so bring some extra if you love s'mores like we do. There are 4 kayaks and 1 stand-up paddle board to use. The lake is very calm so paddling was easy.

Beautifully remodeled and so clean. Our three dogs had plenty of space and enjoyed the backyard and deck.

I'd recommend a butcher's block table or something more substantial.
Showers were AHHHHMAZING. Fantastic water pressure and shower heads were so wonderful. Only weird quirk in the bathrooms were the size of the bath towels. They were more like a large hand towel? We almost bought larger ones.
The beds were VERY firm with non-supportive pillows, so that would be something to consider with your stay. Two nights on them was okay but a third night and we would've been sore.
Overall, wonderful house that we would return to! Responsive owners and clean!
